document.title: West Virginia College- and Career-Readiness Standards for Social Studies

516F1FCAF6D84C4482EBFC9F900FA7D2.description: political management, legal system and stability

C476CF2A63D6410591EFAF79F4C255AE.description: income, industry, trade and Gross Domestic Product

FF7850477BE54259A79BA7E4FA3245D3.description: population (including migration, immigration, birth rate and life expectancy)

60C9E5430E3F47D5A989C9FB8383E0BA.description: compare and contrast the factors of development for developed and developing countries, including the causes and implications of the following:

A6ADD61446454412A9D922EFBF5126A2.description: Explore various routes of personal travel and topography using geographic information systems.

01C70160BBC9476BBDDC9EEE4F494239.description: Analyze the consequences of human and environmental interaction using geographic information systems.

07CF285C868F4352B13F11B6F78B8BC7.description: Analyze the role of sustainable development in the lives of 21st Century citizens (e.g. renewable energy, recycling, reusing, land use policy, ocean management and energy policy) to balance healthy economic growth with environmental protection.

15A365F73B444C2097A3A1BE83A43A47.description: Conduct research using demographic data to interpret, debate and evaluate the geopolitical implications of a variety of global issues:

520D62F66CD34474825961DFC025D67B.description: use census data and public records to identify patterns of change and continuity to understand the impact of the following on society:

8283C7CCBE934659BFAC4916E3881F1C.description: insurance (e.g., life insurance, health insurance, automobile insurance, home and renters insurance and retirement plans).

8A7C4F2C006240788A0863DE5E0987D6.description: investments (e.g., stocks, mutual funds, certificates of deposits and commodity trading)

EFC26840C6DA41C88FEF94CEF058DF06.description: Examine financial habits that promote economic security, stability and growth:

0E4B85DF00194FFCA019DC38125C4E3F.description: Utilize traditional and online banking services as well as examining fees, services and hidden costs of checking, savings, debit cards, Certificates of Deposit, etc.

4FD660FB28A1425289948E6915961C84.description: Develop the knowledge and practices of a savvy consumer who knows consumer rights and responsibilities, can identify and avoid fraudulent practices and guard against identify theft.

84BB8BBA5CCE4D0B824DAD63390EC03F.description: Examine the advantages and disadvantages of different types of consumer debt to make sound financial decisions (e.g., home loans, credit card debt, automobile loans, pay-day loans and rent-to-own).

4D599AD581F84FFD9C860348C92CEB3F.description: Complete Federal and State income tax forms and examine other state and local taxes.

E74CA231640646EE9BA7CF71CE2E1CE0.description: Examine the causes of bankruptcy and how to avoid them.

AB29EE151CF647C78BE8F60837805FBC.description: Identify workplace expectation, including prompt attendance, timeliness and efficiencies.

235418A16B074455B105B6007D79B526.description: Develop a resume showing skills, experiences and education that can be used when applying for a job, a scholarship, or college.

82C8BEBBD6A5436588ABB675BC27B900.description: Examine the expectations and benefits of potential careers and their impact on lifelong earning potential

D25C1C8069E143A59AD2D3A86D06AF14.description: Explore how benefits packages, unions, and professional organizations impact lifestyle and career choices.

6554986E549140CF938A2BCD6412FB43.description: Compare and contrast the budgets of a high school graduate and a recent college graduate.

1EFDBD5B199B487BAC8AB7C06D74976C.description: Construct, utilize, and monitor a budget for a recent college graduate.

CF241985106F4F63B33A4FC21EC90929.description: Construct, utilize, and monitor a budget for a recent high school graduate.

DB69DC2BC09E4B36A991F348A2A4F1A2.description: Investigate the consequences of personal choices in relation to finances.

7E255C2620C84AB383C5C25DDB2DF767.description: Explore how earning a degree impacts lifestyle, lifelong earning potential, and personal wants versus needs.

DC2D6F50FF4149E38D50B54C5961B29E.description: Differentiate between gross and net income (e.g., taxes, insurance and pension plans).

161AD29BA73B412FB258C338F8BF8331.description: Differentiate the annual income of a college graduate compared to a high school graduate.

341162EF96394A6CA6574A33426C5156.description: Evaluate income, lifestyle, and career opportunities based on education and financial aid decisions.

AC3B876179504EC0A2CB12DE91640B3A.description: Explore the application process for student loan qualifications and the repayment process.

A1BBEA961C4E4D5B929A68D285F5C1B0.description: Examine and understand Financial Aid terminology (e.g. FAFSA, EFC, grant, cost of attendance).

D2E88F0D7F79429096262B98CF4EFA71.description: Examine the net price different postsecondary institutions utilizing the net price calculator required to be posted on all postsecondary institution's web pages.

88696160B62E4AD8BF7639837BE2AB29.description: Determine personal expenses (hobbies, restaurants, entertainment, transportation, gas, bills, rent, insurance, cellphone).

018D23F035594F0D84A146CCF4E0AB81.description: Compare text book costs (used books, new books, digital rentals, Amazon, eCampus, local bookstore, text loaning programs).

841B0CDB1241432BA6A889CB4EFEB1BB.description: Examine commuting costs for attending a local institution (gas, car maintenance, distance, time).

795EA7D7286544A78C07D24377D915FD.description: Examine room and board cost for students that live on campus.

33EA496D0C474988B56873B1B833E098.description: Determine the tuition and fees of several specific public and private, two and four year institutions.

F4F39D5041D84DF190622659C409F74B.description: Investigate the cost of postsecondary education.

DCF01CC1189B49BEA59EFBE4F7F7F01E.description: Track the evolution of currency throughout history to facilitate the exchange of goods and services.

2A5C30272657439B97C55341A7FFA994.description: Identify economic influences that impact business climate on the local, regional and global level.

A0F5973E98284EA9AD0F32895A68FCB5.description: Describe how households, businesses and government interact in a free-market economy.

6D68B081D3B743CE875F8FF31901B45D.description: Debate the role of government in a free-market economy.

FA39A8842FA84DC2A2D4989851A7FAA7.description: Explain how supply and demand affects prices, profits, and availability of goods and services.

5658F24252D44698BF964F88A1903812.description: Debate an effective allocation of the factors of production that encourages healthy economic growth and sustainability while curbing environmental abuses in the global community.

CD32A4CF0F5F4E8A919160BD7A80E130.description: Examine the opportunity costs in ever-present scarcity for individuals, businesses and societies to understand how to make choices when facing unlimited wants with limited resources.

ED45A42F0AD84734A150EB0A8FB48699.description: Compare and contrast the values, ideals and principles that are the foundation of a democratic republic and the role citizens play in a constitutional democracy, to the theories and practices of non-democratic governments (e.g. socialism found in communism and nationalism found in fascism).

E25FA1DD27BC421AA2AB398D8DD80B3A.description: Explore cooperation, competition and conflict among nations through organizations, agreements and protocols, political acts and other exchanges—such as the United Nations, international treaties and terrorism—to evaluate potential solutions to global issues.

B5369499F64843D799E39248269BD732.description: Examine how decisions and policies of state and local government impact the lives of citizens—such as local issues and problems, structure of local government (e.g., differences in incorporation, providing public services and mayoral styles), zoning and annexation, land use and urban sprawl, and ordinances and jurisdiction.

42EF1DDC5CA24DFE9E10B9E802319175.description: Assess how factors such as campaign finance, participation of the electorate, and demographic factors influence the outcome of elections.

7DAB21909D9241AA89C5C5D83B3D2CF2.description: Investigate the impact that special interest groups have on shaping public policy at local, state and national levels.

60F21270CD964DC0A4C71F624F827958.description: push-pull polls and selective reporting of citizen opinions

165FAFF4E1A44F05B65685A8A74B8651.description: Assess the influence of the media on public opinion and on the decisions of elected officials and the bureaucracy:

DC6B5BDF18DE403AB37E4C13047FAEA7.description: Critique the evolution of the two-party system in the United States, evaluate how society and political parties have changed over time and analyze how political parties function today.

1A777734B98542F39994E15601F2F9D0.description: Develop an understanding of the American legal system through examining existing ordinances, statutes and Federal Acts, exploring the differences between criminal and civil law and determining the legal obligations and liabilities of American citizenship.

9D5C3152ED51480485A6D03D5EC3B9C3.description: Apply the concepts of legal precedent through past and present landmark Supreme Court cases, interpretations of the U.S. Constitution by the Supreme Court and the impact of these decisions on American society.

9ABBDDAACB624995A47D6916DE3FA39F.description: Compare and contrast the original and appellate jurisdictions of local, state and national judicial systems to show how America's court system addresses criminal and civil cases.

6FBCB849150345A8AD2C2FA3C4ED1B3B.description: Determine how conflicts between the rights of citizens and society's need for order can be resolved while preserving both liberty and safety.

2C76A2E52D1541B18E4F211A309C347A.description: Analyze how the freedoms of speech and press in a democratic society enable citizens to develop informed opinions, express their views, shape public policy and monitor government actions.

8E0E43DE45B94E729EDB1ACB140626F2.description: Analyze the protection of liberties in the Bill of Rights and their expansion through judicial review and the gradual incorporation of those rights by the Fourteenth Amendment.

5B0A875F89AC40988690ECCB4A562F86.description: Analyze how the U.S. Constitution defines federalism and outlines a structure for the United States government.

EE01EF73A059404C8C8FEF7ED83CC799.description: Investigate the system of government created by the Preamble, Seven Articles, the Bill of Rights and other Amendments of the U.S. Constitution to evaluate how the framework for American society is provided.

87DFC84BE24F48EC8DD0C0F6BF9239EC.description: Evaluate the elements in the U.S. Constitution that make it a living document with democratic principles that are modified and expanded to meet the changing needs of society.

9D13A9719F9144C98DB62548B20F1DFE.description: Examine the compromises of the Constitutional Convention and how those decisions were characterized in the Federalist and the Anti-Federalist papers.

12E1935A328B4F2DA882759CFC35F860.description: principles (e.g., popular sovereignty, federalism, limited government, separation of powers, checks and balances, civil liberties and rule of law

D2A743EA6A364DD5906F3B64B636ACBE.description: classical periods (e.g., eras of Greece and Rome)

61190BBB31D440CAB149A43B84DE7F16.description: documents (e.g., English Bill of Rights, Petition of Right and Magna Carta)

8DBA8937E6124A079A9D2E5272CCAC70.description: events (e.g., Glorious Revolution, Reformation and Enlightenment)

36718E0D4D85497294F953766C105EFC.description: leaders and philosophers (e.g., John Locke, James Madison, Thomas Jefferson and John Adams)

1C84EA3A6CF441DC9E170E7B14B0B724.description: Examine and analyze the contributing factors to the drafting of the Declaration of Independence and the U.S. Constitution:

BBFFD840B1D349DFB5D51DA648261365.description: Consider factors that subvert liberty (including lack of education, voter apathy, disenfranchisement, civil inequalities, economic issues, loss of public trust and misuse of government power), then collaborate, compromise, and by consensus, create a model that informed citizens can use to defend and perpetuate the American Republic.

AC2687D901C94C91A0FFC8BC3BAC2829.description: Demonstrate that the purpose of American government is the protection of personal, political and economic rights of citizens as evidenced by the Declaration of Independence, the U. S. Constitution, Constitutional Amendments and the ideas of those involved in the establishment of American government.

866349504E5B43A4B54223E86661781A.description: Explore social contracts and the establishment of the rule of law, and evaluate how limited government and the rule of law protect individual rights.

659CD8D9C1084D3F92B7065D0969D782.description: Strive to become vigilant, informed citizens who actively participate in the preservation and improvement of American government through community service and service-learning (e.g., individual service projects, patriotic events, mock trials, group initiatives, community volunteerism).
